message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

This paper deals with natural language processing (NLP) and cross-lingual transfer, which are core topics in the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also involves building models to predict optimal transfer languages, which falls under the sub-category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of features such as phylogenetic similarity, typological properties, lexical overlap, and size of available data to select transfer languages also suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the experiments on NLP tasks may involve computer vision techniques, leading to a possible connection to computer vision (cs.CV).
